humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 2.2 x 2.2 x 2 cm, which is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Based on the rules provided, this falls under T2. The histological type is infiltrating ductal and lobular carcinoma, but the T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma or invasive lobular carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage from this report is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The tumor size in the report is 2.2 x 2.2 x 2 cm. According to the TNM staging system for cancer, a T2 designation is given to tumors that are greater than 2 cm in size but not greater than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
